intro: Isotrema tonkinense, commonly known as the Tonkin isotrema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
